title.narrative: Addressing VAW&SRHR of Women on the Move

description.narrative: THE WOMEN <(>&<)> YOUTH EMPOWERMENT FOR ADVANCEMENT <(>&<)> HEALTH INITIATIVE is a non-Governmental, non -Profit; non # Political and non # Religious Organization founded in November 2011 and was duly registered with corporate Affairs commission in December 2012.The Organization plays a new and energizing role in bringing Women and Youths who are leaders in many fields into elective and appointive positions to promote Health, Democracy, Peace and good Governance in Nigeria. WYEAHI works towards providing comprehensive care and support that will bring relief to the families and communities who are affected by HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis and other related infectious diseases in a loving and compassionate way and mitigate the scourge of these infection among these two key groups and beyond through result oriented strategies to give hope to the hopeless. WHEAHI provides comprehensive training and support for Women andYouths at all levels of Government on Health, Politics and Economic Empowerment. This enables women and youth to participate fully in elective and appointive position for good governance in Nigeria. Part of its strategic objective is to promote leadership qualities in Nigerian women and Youths, to train and support women and youths in peaceful democratic Leadership. Promote health and sustainable human development and to establish linkage and foster relations co-operation among faith based organization and community basedorganization and non - Governmental organization. Provide support for less privileged and unreached population for charity only andconduct regular seminars and training on dangers of unhealthy living. Also is to promote effective conflict resolution through workshop/training on conflict management among women and youth and advocate for the enactment of the law for the protection of women, Youths and children. WYEAHI#s strategies for achieving its objectives include: Advocacy and focus group discussions/interactive sessions, inter-personal communication among stakeholders, community leaders, religious groups, and policy makers to ensure participatory programming at all levels. WYRAHI uses production and distribution of information, education and communication materials/behavioral change and communication materials, capacity building which include: training, seminars <(>&<)> workshops, (peer group educators training) to realize its objectives. Entertainment, which include: drama, role-play music, and video playback, Research/documentation and resource library on reproductive health, nutritional materials, environmental and personal hygiene are also part of the strategy.Establishment of innovative and creative sources of economic and sustainable development, establishment of linkages and foster relationship/co-operation among faith based organizations (FBO#s), community based organizations (CBO#s) and Non-Governmental organizations (NGO#s) and to conduct participatory monitoring and evaluation at all level. Active participation at events eg Paper presentation during religious convention to women and youth e.g. ZME and FOMWAN among others. WYEAHI will focus on creating awareness programmeactivities on the VAPP Act 2015 about women's right to bodily integrity gender justice , prevention of sexual violence as a weaponof conflict and the reintegration of survivors into the communities, provide adequate referrals services to survivors and campaignagainst violence against women including the sexual reproductive rights of women on the move in North East Nigeria.

participating-org.narrative: THE WOMEN & YOUTH EMPOWERMENT FOR ADVANCEMENT & HEALTH INITIATIVE is a non-Governmental, non -Profit; non # Political and non # Religious Organization founded in November 2011 and was duly registered with corporate Affairs commission in December 2012. The Organization plays a new and energizing role in bringing Women and Youths who are leaders in many fields into elective and appointive positions to promote Health, Democracy, Peace and good Governance in Nigeria. WYEAHI works towards providing comprehensive care and support that will bring relief to the families and communities who are affected by HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis and other related infectious diseases in a loving and compassionate way and mitigate the scourge of these infection among these two key groups and beyond through result oriented strategies to give hope to the hopeless. WHEAHI provides comprehensive training and support for Women and Youths at all levels of Government on Health, Politics and Economic Empowerment. This enables women and youth to participate fully in elective and appointive position for good governance in Nigeria. Part of its strategic objective is to promote leadership qualities in Nigerian women and Youths, to train and support women and youths in peaceful democratic Leadership. Promote health and sustainable human development and to establish linkage and foster relations co-operation among faith based organization and community based organization and non - Governmental organization. Provide support for less privileged and unreached population for charity only and conduct regular seminars and training on dangers of unhealthy living. Also is to promote effective conflict resolution through workshop/training on conflict management among women and youth and advocate for the enactment of the law for the protection of women, Youths and children. WYEAHI#s strategies for achieving its objectives include: Advocacy and focus group discussions/interactive sessions, inter-personal communication among stakeholders, community leaders, religious groups, and policy makers to ensure participatory programming at all levels. WYRAHI uses production and distribution of information, education and communication materials/behavioral change and communication materials, capacity building which include: training, seminars <(>&<)> workshops, (peer group educators training) to realize its objectives. Entertainment, which include: drama, role-play music, and video playback, Research/documentation and resource library on reproductive health, nutritional materials, environmental and personal hygiene are also part of the strategy. Establishment of innovative and creative sources of economic and sustainable development, establishment of linkages and foster relationship/co-operation among faith based organizations (FBO#s), community based organizations (CBO#s) and Non-Governmental organizations (NGO#s) and to conduct participatory monitoring and evaluation at all level. Active participation at events eg Paper presentation during religious convention to women and youth e.g. ZME and FOMWAN among others
